title: Serif font ("LEGACY LANGUAGE SOLUTIONS")
content:
Serif font that could not be 100% accurately identified by online applications

Font: 

 Trajan (Bold) BY Carol Twombly 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419081110/http:/www.typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Legacy Language Solutions Logo1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419081110/http:/typophile.com/files/Legacy%20Language%20Solutions%20Logo1_0.png) | 10.76 KB |
author: Abatjour3407

comments.content:
I think it's **[Byington](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419081110/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Typodermic%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Byington%20-%20Regular&fid=64eb8c1daa6985c605ef1eadb3227730&fsize=60&text=LEGACY%20LANGUAGE%20SOLUTIONS&wrap=2)** by Ray Larabie [Typodermic, 2005]

EDIT: Ryuk is right, Trajan is a closer match and it also offers the small caps of the sample ;)
Thanks! They're actually both pretty close :). You guys are fast B-)
Thanks! Spot on!!! :). Some of the font details I didn't even notice being such poor quality a pic (e.g. the curviness of the font). Thanks!! :D

Please post Font Identification requests in the appropriate forum: [http://www.typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419081110/http:/www.typophile.com/typeid "http://www.typophile.com/typeid") in the future.
